a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: The number of conflicts divided by the number of all states. This accounts for the changing number of states

over time. Included are
interstate
,
intrastate
,
extrasystemic
,
non-state
conflicts, and
one-sided violence
that
Data source: Uppsala Conflict Data Program and Peace Research Institute Oslo (2025)
Note: Some conflicts affect several regions. The sum across all regions can therefore be higher than the global number.
